results.title: The Blue angel (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Josef von Sternberg, Erich Pommer and UFA
results.brief_description: The infatuation of a professor for a nightclub singer leads to his downfall. Sternberg reversed the meaning of Heinrich Mann’s novel “Professor Unrath” by making the professor a foolish, repressed victim rather than the corrupt and hypocritical exploiter of Lola portrayed in the novel. The film already shows Sternberg’s interest in visual density rather than narrative vigour, creating atmosphere rather than narrative tension, a preference for the maximum expressiveness of decor and lighting over surface realism. Stars Marlene Dietrich, Emil Jannings, Hans Albers and Kurt Gerron. Note: German dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: The Blue Angel
results.brief_description: Prim professor Immanuel Rath finds some of his students ogling photos of cabaret performer Lola Lola and visits a local club, The Blue Angel, to catch them there. When the teacher himself falls for Lola Lola, life becomes difficult.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

results.description: Prim professor Immanuel Rath finds some of his students ogling racy photos of cabaret performer Lola Lola and visits a local club, The Blue Angel, in an attempt to catch them there. Seeing Lola perform, the teacher is filled with lust, eventually resigning his position at the school to marry the young woman. However, his marriage to a coquette — whose job is to entice men — proves to be more difficult than Rath imagined.
description_for_label: Prim professor Immanuel Rath finds some of his students ogling racy photos of cabaret performer Lola Lola and visits a local club, The Blue Angel, in an attempt to catch them there. Seeing Lola perform, the teacher is filled with lust, eventually resigning his position at the school to marry the young woman. However, his marriage to a coquette — whose job is to entice men — proves to be more difficult than Rath imagined.

results.title: The Blowfly menace
results.creator_credit: A. C. McKay BVSc and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: For farmers and graziers this study of the life-cycle of the green blowfly and other flies associated with blowfly strike in sheep, and demonstrations of various methods of control, should prove both useful and interesting.

results.title: The Blowfly
results.brief_description: This film depicts the life-cycle of one of the most common blowflies, the blue-bottle, calliphora erythrocephala. It is the big blue fly which everybody has seen settling on meat or occasionally buzzing about in the house.

results.title: The Bloodhouse
results.creator_credit: Humphrey McQueen, Garry Lane and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: The power of big companies like BHP deeply affects our economy and environment and our way of life. The film describes the effects of highly developed capitalist industry - environmental pollution, disregard for workers conditions and the exploitation of migrant workers. The film shows conditions which helped to earn the Port Kembla steelworks the title of ‘Bloodhouse’.

results.title: The Blood of the beast = Le sang des betes
results.creator_credit: Georges Franju, Paul Le Gros and Forces et Voix de la France
results.brief_description: Classic documentary on a Paris slaughterhouse by Georges Franju which juxtaposes poetry and realism. Narrated by Jean Painleve and photographed by Marcel Fradetal. Music by Joseph Kosma. WARNING: Very graphic footage of animal slaughter.

results.title: The Blood
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Describes the circulation of the blood, its composition and its functions in supporting cell processes. Photomicrography, animation and demonstrations are used to show blood cell structure and locomotion, the formation of new blood cells, blood circulation and capillary structure and function. Also explains blood typing and the test for the Rh factor. Suitable for upper secondary levels.
